instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 1,5V going up to 2V.
threads.message:
Hi,

Have got this machine with no water damage:


<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> was fucked so i changed it, also <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>. After that macbook turned on, begin to charge the battery for some minutes. Than failed again.


Now when connect magsafe first it begins with intermiten green light, after a minute it stays stable. PPBUS about 1,5V. All other rails seems be present and ok.

Randomly light turn amber but no change in rails voltages.

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 1,5V going up to 2V.
threads.message: Solved. changed <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> again and now it's working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 1,5V going up to 2V.
threads.message: Probably first <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> replacement had bad solders...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 1,5V going up to 2V.
threads.message: The problem back. Every time i change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> it works for a couple of hour, charging and detecting charger good, and after that it only works from battery. If change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> it works again but for shor time. Any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 1,5V going up to 2V.
threads.message: What is PPBUS when the machine doesn't turn on same voltage? I would be <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> is continuously killing your ISL chips

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> PPBUS 1,5V going up to 2V.
threads.message:
Post exact value for <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86, measured onboard in ohm scale.
This way helps to discard <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> leakage issue.
